strategy_reasoning: Using a 'Patch Notes as RPG Quest Log' approach. By framing technical updates (bot hardening, new apps) as character 'level ups' and 'new party members' in a pixel art RPG style, we make dry dev updates feel cozy and rewarding. The lime green (#ecf874) anchors the brand while the Stardew-esque visuals keep it friendly.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art title screen resembling a retro game start menu. Large chunky text says 'FRESH POLLEN'. The background is a vibrant lime green (#ecf874) with soft pastel clouds. A cute 8-bit bee mascot is hovering near the text. Warm lighting, scanline effect, nostalgic vibes. High quality pixel art.
images.description: Intro slide setting the cozy gaming mood.

images.prompt: Pixel art scene showing two new tiny characters entering a digital garden. One character represents 'Sage' (a wise little robot with a chat bubble), the other represents 'Korpi' (a character holding a glowing storybook). Soft lavender and mint background with lime green (#ecf874) grass. Cozy 8-bit style like Stardew Valley. Warm, inviting atmosphere.
images.description: Visualizing the new apps (Sage and Korpi) as new friends joining the ecosystem.

images.prompt: Pixel art close-up of the Pollinations Bee mascot wearing a tiny wizard hat (symbolizing independent thinking) and holding a small pixelated shield (symbolizing security/hardening). The bee looks confident. Background is a soft gradient of peach and lime green (#ecf874). Floating pixel sparkles. 'LEVEL UP' text in retro font.
images.description: Visualizing the Polly bot security and logic upgrades as a character RPG level-up.
